statement.p: Snell's Law about refraction applied to sound can be stated as \displaystyle\frac{{\sin{{\left(\theta_{{1}}\right)}}}}{{\sin{{\left(\theta_{{2}}\right)}}}}=\frac{{V}_{{1}}}{{V}_{{2}}}.

\displaystyle{V}_{{1}}={4700} m/s in copper and \displaystyle{V}_{{2}}={5180} in tungsten. If an ultrasonic sound crosses from copper into tungsten at an angle of \displaystyle{45}^{\circ}. What angle from the normal will the sound make in the tungsten?
